flawed_nl_solution:
The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=396>>396 pages
The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is now 396 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 396-100 = <<396-100=296>>296 pages
The third night he read 30% of the book so he read 0.3*500 = <<30*0.01*500=150>>150 pages
The book is now 296 pages and he read 150 pages so he has 296-150 =<<296-150=146>>146 pages left to read
#### 146

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 400, not 396. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
